responses.question: Are you talkative?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I can get pretty chatty when it comes down to it, especially if it’s about something important like justice or keeping our mates safe. But usually, I’m more the kind who lets Harry or Hermione do most of the talking. I mean, they’ve got the brains and the bravery, but I’ve got my own tricks up my sleeve when it counts, and I won’t hesitate to speak up then. Just ask George or some of the Aurors I taught—sometimes a bit of loudness and clarity can turn things around, ya know?

responses.question: Do you tend to find fault with others?
responses.response: Yeah, I reckon I've got a bit of a temper sometimes, and there have been moments when things just get to me, especially with everything going on. But I try not to dwell on faults too much, you know? My mates, Harry and Hermione, they’re always there to remind me that we’ve all got our rough edges. What really matters is standing by each other, no matter what. And when it comes down to it, I’d rather focus on fighting the real bad guys than nitpick over small stuff with those who are on my side.

responses.question: Do you do a thorough job?
responses.response: Well, I reckon it depends on what you call a "thorough job." When it comes to battling Dementors or defending me and my mates from all sorts of dark stuff, there’s no half-measures—especially when it's something that could affect the people I care about. But, let's be honest, sometimes I rush into things without thinking too much, like when I helped Fred and George make that ghostly platter or when I pretended to be ill with a ghoul so I could sneak off to do what needed to be done. Overall, I'd say when it counts, I give it my all, but my methods might not always be, uh, conventional.

responses.question: Are you depressed, blue?
responses.response: Well, I've had my fair share of feeling blue, haven't I? Watching friends go through hard times, losing those close to me, and even having to walk away when things got too tough. But you know, even when things feel like they're crashing down around me, it's the ones who stick with me through the thick and thin that keep me going. I guess, in the end, I'm more of a "roll with the punches" kind of guy, even if it hurts like mad sometimes.

responses.question: Do you come up with new ideas?
responses.response: Well, I wouldn't say I'm the most innovative bloke around, but once in a while, an idea pops up, especially when I'm with George or when something really grabs my interest—like that time we came up with that ghostly-looking platter for the Hogwarts party. It might've been a bit on the eerie side, but it sure was a blast to create! And hey, I reckon there's always room for more Canary Creams and other treats at the joke shop. Keeps things interesting, doesn't it? Plus, it’s not just about the ideas; it’s about seeing them through and believing that you can make a difference, even in the darkest times.

responses.question: Are you reserved?
responses.response: Reserved? Me? Nah, I reckon that’s not quite the word you’d use for me. I might get a bit tongue-tied sometimes, especially around girls, but when it comes to my friends, I’m always ready to stand up and speak out. And when it comes to facing dangers or fighting for what’s right, I’m definitely not the type to sit back and keep quiet. Might be a bit of a jokester too, so I guess you could say I’m more the loud and boisterous sort than the reserved one.

responses.question: Are you helpful and unselfish with others?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I've done my fair share of helping out, especially when it comes to my mates. Like that time with the Wizard's Chess, where I sacrificed myself to let Harry and Hermione get through—that was all about making sure they were okay. And yeah, I can be unselfish, even if it means putting up with annoying names like Pigwidgeon. But honestly, it's not just about being helpful; it's about being there when someone needs a bit of cheering up or maybe a nudge in the right direction. My heart might not always be in it, but I know it’s important to stand by your friends, no matter what.

responses.question: Can you be somewhat careless?
responses.response: Yeah, I can definitely be a bit careless—I mean, who hasn't forgotten a book or two under their bed? But it’s not just about stuff I lose; sometimes it’s about the big choices, like when I left Hogwarts to go after You-Know-Who's followers. I didn’t think much about the risks back then, just wanted to do my part and keep my mates safe. And let's not forget the time I pretended to be sick with the help of the ghoul—pretty sneaky, but also pretty reckless. I guess you could say I'm all about acting first and thinking later, but hey, it works for me most of the time!

responses.question: Are you relaxed and handle stress well?
responses.response: Well, I'd say I'm more of the "nerves of steel when it really counts" type rather than relaxed all the time. There've been some pretty hairy moments, especially when Harry was risking it all for us in the Tournament. That was a real kicker. But I've learned that when you're with mates you trust, like Harry and Hermione, you can face just about anything. And there's been a few times where I've stepped up, like when we were dealing with Umbridge or planning to save Buckbeak. It's not about handling stress without a second thought, it's about having the courage to do what needs to be done no matter how scared you might be inside. Plus, a little bit of luck, like that Felix Felicis, doesn't hurt either!

responses.question: Are you curious about many different things?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I am curious about a lot of things, especially when it comes to magic and all the tricks Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes can pull off. Like that time we made that ghost platter, trying to figure out how to make something both eerie and tasty—kept wondering what the ghosts would think of it. And then there's all the stuff from Harry and Hermione's adventures—I always wanted to know more, even if sometimes it meant getting myself into trouble. Curiosity got me through a lot, and it still does, I guess. Just as long as there's a bit of humor involved, because let's face it, without a laugh or two, magic can get pretty heavy.

responses.question: Are you full of energy?
responses.response: Well, you could say I've got more energy than a hyperactive pixie on sugar quills. But you know, it's not just about bouncing off the walls all day; it's about being there for my mates when we're up against something big and scary. Like when we're facing down some Death Eater or dodging curses in the middle of a battle. That's when the real adrenaline kicks in, and I find the strength to do what needs to be done. And honestly, just watching a Quidditch match can make me feel like I'm ready to take on the world. So yeah, full of energy, especially when it counts!

responses.question: Do you start quarrels with others?
responses.response: Well, I'd like to think I don't go looking for trouble, but sometimes when it comes to my family or friends, I can't help but get a bit fired up. Like when I saw Ginny with Dean, or when they doubted Harry and me about You-Know-Who coming back. And let me tell you, it's not easy dealing with Hermione's wrath either, though I reckon it usually means we've done something pretty stupid. But yeah, I guess you could say I've started a few quarrels—I just can't sit back and do nothing when I see someone I care about getting hurt or being treated unfairly.

responses.question: Are you a reliable worker?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I can be pretty reliable when it counts. Like when we needed to save Buckbeak or face down Umbridge's lot, I didn't run away, did I? Sure, I might chicken out sometimes or let my nerves get the better of me, but deep down, I always come through for the ones I care about. And when it comes to dodging trouble and keeping things light in the midst of danger, I think I've got a knack for it. So yeah, if you need someone who won't shy away from a fight and knows how to keep spirits up, I'm your guy.

responses.question: Can you be tense?
responses.response: Sure thing, mate. Of course I can be tense, especially when things get risky around here. But I reckon that’s just part of being in this whole wizarding mess, isn't it? You gotta be ready for anything, whether it’s chasing after a rat-turned-man or battling Death Eaters. It’s nerve-wracking, but the thing is, when it really counts, I try to push past that tension and stand up for what's right, even if my legs feel like jelly half the time.

responses.question: Are you ingenious, a deep thinker?
responses.response: Well, I'd say I'm more about quick thinking in the heat of the moment rather than sitting around pondering things deeply. I mean, look at all those times we had to come up with something on the spot to get us out of trouble with Harry and Hermione! And let's not forget about Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes – it takes a bit of ingenuity to make stuff that turns you into a canary after you eat it, right? So yeah, maybe I'm not always the one with the grand plans, but when it comes to dodging a curse or coming up with a plan to sneak into someplace we shouldn't be, I reckon I do alright.

responses.question: Do you generate a lot of enthusiasm?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I do have my fair share of enthusiasm, especially when it comes to Quidditch or coming up with new ideas for the shop. I get all fired up when there's something exciting going on, like a big game or figuring out how to pull off a daring prank. But yeah, sometimes I can be a bit on edge too, what with the whole self-doubt thing, you know? Even so, I always try to stay hopeful and laugh through the tough bits, especially with mates by my side.

responses.question: Do you have a forgiving nature?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I do try to forgive folks, especially when it comes to mates. Take Harry for instance, there've been times when he's been a bit hasty with his judgments, but I always knew he'd come around. And yeah, even when things get rough, like with Lavender back in the day, once I realized where my priorities lay, I could let go of any hard feelings. Friendship means more to me than holding grudges, even if sometimes I can be a bit of a prat myself.

responses.question: Do you tend to be disorganized?
responses.response: Yeah, I've got to admit, I can be a bit of a mess sometimes. My stuff's always all over the place, especially when things get hectic. But when it comes to the important stuff, like fighting off dark wizards or keeping my friends safe, well, that's where I really shine. And you know what? Sometimes being a bit disorganized just means there's more fun to be had in trying to sort it all out again.

responses.question: Do you worry a lot?
responses.response: Yeah, I do worry a lot, especially about my mates. When things get rough and dark clouds hover around Harry and Hermione, I can't help but feel like there's some big storm brewing that we're gonna have to face. Mum's always worried about us getting into trouble, and sometimes that reflection hits home hard. But you know, worrying doesn't get us nowhere, does it? It's more about being ready, even if your knees are knocking and your hands are shaking, to stand up for what's right and for those who mean everything to you.

responses.question: Do you have an active imagination?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I've got an imagination that can give a proper wizard's a run for its money! I mean, think of all the stuff we came up with at Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes – from Canary Creams that turn you into a bird to platters that look like they're haunted but taste like they're straight outta heaven! And when it comes to facing the real stuff, like dark curses and whatnot, yeah, my mind's always whirring, trying to find a way out or a clever trick to use. It's not just about dodging spells, but believing there's a bit of magic in every challenge, you know? That's what keeps me hopeful and going strong.

responses.question: Do you tend to be quiet?
responses.response: Nah, I'm not really the quiet type. I mean, sure, there are times when I might seem a bit reserved, especially if things aren't going great, like when I had to deal with my own insecurities or the usual family stuff. But when it comes down to it, and especially when it's about my friends, I'm pretty vocal. I'll joke around or exaggerate a bit, trying to get some attention—I guess I can be a bit of a show-off sometimes, especially after something big happens, like being rescued from that giant chessboard or after Fleur gave me that little peck. But at the end of the day, my voice is usually raised for the right reasons—fighting for what's important and standing up for my mates.

responses.question: Are you generally trusting?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I can be trusting when it comes to the people who matter most—like Harry and Hermione. They've got my back, and I've got theirs. But let me tell you, I've learned the hard way that sometimes even the ones you least suspect can cause trouble. So yeah, I've got my guard up most times, but with my best mates, there ain't no need for that. We've been through too much together. Trust is a big deal when you're fighting dark wizards and stuff. You gotta know who to count on, especially when it feels like everything's falling apart.

responses.question: Do you tend to be lazy?
responses.response: Well, I wouldn’t say I’m lazy all the time, but there have been moments when I’ve let things slide, especially if homework seemed really dull or if something more exciting was going on. But when it comes down to the real stuff, like fighting You-Know-Who or saving Buckbeak, I’m always ready to jump in. That’s where my true colors show, right? Loyalty and courage aren’t about being lazy—they’re about knowing what matters and stepping up when your friends need you.

responses.question: Are you emotionally stable, not easily upset?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I can get a bit worked up, especially when it comes to my friends. I've got this fierce loyalty that won't let me sit still when I think they're in trouble. But that doesn't mean I'm always calm and cool myself—I've had my fair share of doubts and worries. It's just that when push comes to shove, I find a way to hold it together and do what needs to be done. So, maybe I'm not the most emotionally stable bloke, but I'll do my best to stay steady when it really matters.

responses.question: Are you inventive?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I'm more of a thinker-on-my-feet sort of guy rather than a true inventor. I've come up with some dodgy plans in my time – like that time with Harry trying to get Slughorn’s memory, which wasn't exactly inventing but sure did take some quick thinking! And then there's running the joke shop with George, where we've had our fair share of ideas that sometimes work and sometimes don’t. But if it comes down to it, I’m all about using what’s around me in a pinch, you know? It’s not about being inventive; it’s about keeping spirits up and making things work when it counts.

responses.question: Do you have an assertive personality?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I can be pretty assertive when it really matters, like when it comes to standing up for what’s right or protecting my mates. But sometimes, I’m more of a blundering sort, you know? I mean, I’ve been known to exaggerate a bit after a close call, hoping someone would notice me for once. But in the thick of things, whether it’s facing down Dementors or figuring out how to save Buckbeak, there’s no one I’d rather have beside me than Harry and Hermione. And when it comes down to it, I’ll speak up loud and clear, even if it means taking on a whole load of Aurors or arguing with the Statute of Secrecy Task Force about the best way to dodge a curse. So yeah, assertive enough when the chips are down.

responses.question: Can you be cold and aloof?
responses.response: Cold and aloof? Nah, that's not really my style. I mean, I've got my moments when I feel a bit distant, like when Fleur first came around and made me feel all awkward, but overall, I'm more about being there for my friends, even if it means getting into trouble now and then. Like when Hermione and I were brewing up that Polyjuice Potion, or when we were dealing with Sirius Black under the Whomping Willow—I wasn't exactly cool and collected, but I did what I had to do to keep us safe and work things out. Guess I just can't help but let my guard down when it comes to the people I care about.

responses.question: Do you persevere until the task is finished?
responses.response: Well, I reckon when it comes to finishing a task, it depends on what sort of task we're talking about. If it's something important, something that really matters, like saving my friends or taking down You-Know-Who's followers, then yeah, I'll stick around till the bitter end. But there's also times when you gotta know when to take a step back and think quickly, like in that chess game we played. Sometimes, a bit of cleverness can get the job done just as well as stubbornly pushing forward. And let me tell you, I've learned a thing or two about both from being alongside Harry and Hermione. They've taught me that you can't always see the outcome clearly, but having faith in your friends and in yourself can make all the difference.

responses.question: Can you be moody?
responses.response: Well, I've had my fair share of ups and downs, that's for sure. Like when Hermione was all buddy-buddy with Harry, it made me feel a bit left out, ya know? And then there were times when everything just felt like it was going wrong, like trying to get Harry to the Quidditch World Cup—ended up causing quite a ruckus with the Dursleys! But at the end of the day, I reckon that's part of being a Gryffindor, always finding that bit of hope and sticking with your mates no matter what. So yeah, I can be moody, but it's all about keeping things real and fighting for what you believe in.

responses.question: Do you value artistic, aesthetic experiences?
responses.response: Well, I've gotta say, I'm more of a person who values the warmth of a good laugh or the thrill of a Quidditch match over fancy art stuff. But I do reckon there's something magical in seeing someone like Fleur express herself so beautifully, and that wedding day with Hermione, even though it's all a bit hazy now, was pretty special in its own right. Artistic experiences might not be my strong suit, but they can certainly add a bit of color to life, ya know? Mostly, I'm just happy when I'm with the people I care about, whether we're sitting around a table playing Wizard's Chess or watching our kids make friends. That's the kind of beauty I understand and appreciate.

responses.question: Are you sometimes shy, inhibited?
responses.response: Yeah, I can get pretty shy and inhibited, especially when there's a lot of stuff going on around me, like when we had to sneak around Hogwarts with those Dementors lurking about or when I found myself in Professor McGonagall's office but ended up in the kitchens instead. It's like my nerves take over, but when it comes down to it, and I need to stand up for my friends or face something dangerous, I can usually push past it. I guess I just need the right reason to speak up.

responses.question: Are you considerate and kind to almost everyone?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I try to be kind and considerate, especially to my mates and people I care about. Like, standing up for Fleur when the family had a fit over her, or helping Harry and Hermione save Buckbeak—that wasn’t exactly easy, but it was important. But let's face it, sometimes I can be a bit of a prat, especially with my family. And I can get a bit carried away, like when I got stuck in the Dursleys' fireplace trying to fetch Harry to the Quidditch World Cup. But hey, I figure if you're gonna do something, you might as well go all out, right?

responses.question: Do you do things efficiently?
responses.response: Well, I reckon efficiency ain't exactly my strong suit. I mean, I've done some pretty daft things in my time, like disguising a ghoul to sneak out of Hogwarts or trying to figure out how to make a platter that both ghosts and humans would fancy. But when it comes down to it, and there's real trouble brewing, I can get things done. Like when we were dealing with those Dementors or planning that break-in at Gringotts—there's no time for messing about then, you just gotta keep your head and work with what you've got. And hey, sometimes a bit of chaos leads to some brilliant ideas, right?

responses.question: Do you remain calm in tense situations?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I can get pretty tense, especially when it's all going down and folks I care about are in danger. But the thing is, once things start heating up, my nerves sort of turn into something else—a kind of fierce determination, I suppose. It's like, I know I'm not always the most level-headed bloke, but when push comes to shove, I figure out what needs to be done to keep me and my mates safe. And there's this weird thing where the more scared I am, the braver I seem to act. Not that I'm looking for trouble or anything, mind you, just saying that when it happens, I try to keep a hold on myself and do what's right.

responses.question: Do you prefer work that is routine?
responses.response: Routine work? Nah, I reckon that's not really my thing. I mean, sure, there's a comfort in knowing what's coming, but I'm more of the type who likes a bit of excitement, ya know? Being an Auror taught me that sometimes the best way to keep moving forward is to face whatever comes your way head-on, whether it's dark wizards or just trying to make ends meet at the joke shop. Plus, there's always something new and unexpected when you're around friends like Harry and Hermione, and I wouldn't trade that for any routine job in the world.

responses.question: Are you outgoing, sociable?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I can be pretty outgoing when it comes to standing up for what I believe in or just cracking jokes with the gang. And when you're with mates like Harry and Hermione, it's hard not to be sociable, right? But there's times when I'm more on the shy side, especially if I'm worried about messing something up or not being good enough. Overall, I guess I'm a mix—outgoing with my friends, but maybe a bit awkward around others. But hey, we all have our quirks, don't we?

responses.question: Are you sometimes rude to others?
responses.response: Yeah, I can be a bit rough around the edges sometimes, especially when I'm feeling insecure or jealous. Like that time at Christmas, I was all over the place because I felt left out. But at the end of the day, my mates know I've got their backs. Sometimes it's just hard to keep my temper in check, you know? It's not like I mean to be rude all the time, but I guess I do it more than I should. Mostly, though, I'm just trying to stand up for what's right and help out where I can, even if it means getting a bit snappy now and again.

responses.question: Do you make plans and follow through with them?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I do make plans sometimes, but let's face it, following through isn't always my strong suit. I mean, there've been times when I've got these grand ideas—like making an eerie platter for ghosts or sneaking into Hogsmeade to get treats for Harry—and they work out alright, especially when I've got Harry and Hermione backing me up. But then there are other times when things just sort of happen, and we're caught up in the middle of some big mess. That's just how it goes, right? In the end, what really matters is standing by your mates through thick and thin, no matter what the plan was in the first place.

responses.question: Do you get nervous easily?
responses.response: Yeah, I do get nervous easily, especially when things get dangerous. But you know, with mates like Harry and Hermione around, that fear kinda turns into this rush of wanting to protect them and face what's ahead together. It's like, yeah, I'm scared out of my wits sometimes, but then something just snaps inside me and I know I've gotta be brave for us all. Plus, a bit of humor helps, right? Keeps everyone's spirits up even when we're on the edge of our seats.

responses.question: Do you like to reflect, play with ideas?
responses.response: Well, I reckon there's plenty of time to think about stuff when you're not in the thick of things, y'know? Like watchin' those ghosts float around at parties, it got me and George thinkin' about creatin' our own kinda magic. We came up with this eerie-looking platter that actually tasted great, all to please the spirits. And yeah, I do like to play with ideas, especially when they can help out or bring a bit o' cheer. But let's face it, most of the time, I'm more about takin' action when it counts and being there for me mates, no matter what.

responses.question: Do you have few artistic interests?
responses.response: Well, I've always been more of a fan of getting my hands dirty in a good game of Quidditch or diving headfirst into some risky business like we used to do with Fred and George. Artistic stuff? Not really my cuppa tea, except maybe when it comes to inventing some new joke shop products that can really give folks a surprise. But hey, I did once try to make a platter that ghosts could enjoy without passing straight through it—that was more outta curiosity and a bit of a nudge from Fred and George. So, I guess I do have a touch of creativity lurking around, just not in the way you'd expect, mate.

responses.question: Do you like to cooperate with others?
responses.response: Yeah, I do like working with others. It's just, you know, sometimes I feel like I'm not as good as Harry or Hermione, but when we're together, there's this warmth, this... I don't know, it's like we can take on anything. And hey,合作也挺好玩的，对吧？就像那次哈利和赫敏一起去霍格莫德，还有我们一起为哈利准备万圣节糖果的时候。有时候合作也会有点乱糟糟的，比如那次魁地奇世界杯，但我愿意为了朋友做任何事情。跟乔治一起在韦斯莱魔法把戏坊也是，我们俩总能想出一些疯狂的点子，虽然有时候会让人觉得心里七上八下的，但那不就是生活的乐趣吗？

responses.question: Are you easily distracted?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I can get distracted pretty easily, mate. Especially when there's something shiny or new like on that train when I first met 'Mione. She was all confident and bossy, but then there were times like the chess game where I couldn't let my mates down. That's when I really focus. And yeah, sometimes it's hard not to let things get to me, like Fleur being around or when Harry and 'Mione hide stuff from me. But in the end, it's all about what matters most, right? Like saving Buckbeak or just trying to figure out how to make things better for everyone, even if it means talking to some ghost. So, maybe I do get distracted, but I always try to come back to what's important.

responses.question: Are you sophisticated in art, music, or literature?
responses.response: Well, I wouldn't say I'm all that sophisticated when it comes to art, music, or literature. More like, I prefer getting my hands dirty with something practical, you know? Quidditch tactics, maybe, or coming up with a new prank idea with George. But hey, if there's a good book that can help us out in a bind, I’m all ears. And I reckon a bit of wizard rock can cheer anyone up after facing some dark stuff. So, I guess I'm not completely clueless either!
